pullRequest.title: DHFPROD-3581: And DHFPROD-3720 - Adding dataservice endpoints to search on facet values

nodes.bodyText: I think this is a good example of where moving this code to a separate private method is a good way to document what it's doing - i.e. "copyTestIndexesFileToProject".

If this file can't be copied, then the tests that depend on it are going to fail. Best to throw an exception now as opposed to letting the system be in a misconfigured state - e.g. throw new RuntimeException("Unable to copy test indexes file to project", ioe);

Pinging @ryanjdew - I think this is too fine-grained for an interface. We want interfaces that are broadly scoped against higher level features in DHF, and each method/endpoint can have a well-defined, narrow scope.
Both of these new endpoints pertain to searching entities. So let's call this service "entitySearch".
Now let's name these methods more from a client perspective, as it's not clear what "numericFacetValuesRange" means (nor does it appear to be bound to numbers). The use case appears to be - get me the min and max values for an entity property. So let's call the method "getMinAndMaxPropertyValues". And let's rename "facetName" to "properetyPath" - this endpoint doesn't need to care about facets, it only cares about indexes.
Should call this propertyPath as well
Let's call this "pattern", which is the same term that the underlying functions use - http://docs.marklogic.com/cts.valueMatch .

Looking at these conditionals, I'm thinking two things:

"indexType" should be called "referenceType", as that's what we're figuring out here - what type of reference should we use?
The values should then correspond to the reference functions - e.g. "element" instead of "elementRangeIndex", "field" instead of "fieldRangeIndex", and then "collection".

Because this is using valueMatch, then from a client's perspective, the requirement appears to be - "get me entity property values that match a pattern". So the endpoint name could be "getMatchingPropertyValues".
Should be able to derive this from the entity model so that the client doesn't have to pass it in or care about it
Should rename this test modules based on the proposed function names above.

Is there a scenario that tests the logic for performing an additional cts.valueMatch query based on a looser pattern? If so, add an assertion message to the test.assertEqual function that states that it's expecting a value based on that second search.

commit.message: DHFPROD-3581: Search within a specific facet of string datatype
DHFPROD-3720: Show range for facets based on numeric data type
DHFPROD-3581: Adding indexes to final-database.json and throwing error if file is not copied
DHFPROD-3581: Adding hub entity services library and tests
DHFPROD-3581: Moving all ds endpoints related to entitySearch under EntitySearch Interface

beforeCommit.message: DHFPROD-3720: Show range for facets based on numeric data type

afterCommit.message: DHFPROD-3581: Moving all ds endpoints related to entitySearch under EntitySearch Interface

nodes.bodyText: For simplicity and consistency, the functionName should match the name of the endpoint file.
As long as this function name needs to be changed, let's change this name too - we know this will now be "entityTypeId".
@ryanjdew I think this is fine here for 5.2.0, I'm thinking we can combine this with entity-lib.sjs in my DHFPROD-4379 PR for 5.3.0.

commit.message: DHFPROD-3581: Renaming properties to match ES naming conventions
